description: Tier 1 English Grammar Validation Rules - Mechanical correctness checks for possessives, articles, tense, agreement, and basic syntax. Enhanced with MMO/Gaming/Comedy timing patterns from Netoge 1124 audit. v1.3 adds AI-ism purple prose blocklist from v1.6 validation.
enhancements_v1_1: Added dialogue_register_errors, comedy_punchline_protection, gaming_culture_authenticity categories based on Netoge vs Fan TL literacy audit findings
enhancements_v1_2: Added rhythm_and_emphasis.target_length_dialogue_examples mirrored from literacy_techniques.mmo_gaming_romcom for live prompt-time grammar enforcement.
enhancements_v1_3: Added ai_ism_purple_prose category with Phase 2 blocklist patterns from v1.6 Chapter 2 validation (Novel 1790). Targets 'I couldn't help but', 'heavy with', 'drilling into', 'locked in volley', 'fleeting swept away', 'welled up' constructions.
usage: Apply after translation to catch mechanical grammar errors before human review

possessive_errors.description: Detect missing or incorrect possessive apostrophes

exceptions: Pattern at start of sentence may be intentional fragment
Dialogue tags: 'Maria said' vs 'Maria's voice'

patterns.issue: Likely JP 'no' transfer causing ambiguous noun stack

examples.review: Choose context-appropriate form: 'the Asanagi mother-daughter duo' or 'Asanagi's mother-daughter duo'

exceptions: Attributive family names that are already idiomatic in context may be acceptable

patterns.issue: Should use possessive 'its' not contraction 'it's'

article_errors.description: Detect missing or incorrect articles (a, an, the)

exceptions: Plural nouns don't need article
Uncountable nouns (water, air, love) don't need article
After possessives: 'his beautiful car' not 'his a beautiful car'
'a user' (yoo sound, not vowel)
'a one-time event' (w sound)
'a European' (yoo sound)

patterns.issue: Singular subject requires singular verb
exceptions: 'You' uses plural form even when singular

patterns.issue: Plural subject requires plural verb
Plural noun after 'There was no' requires 'There were no'

examples.incorrect: There was no tangles in her hair.
examples.correct: There were no tangles in her hair.

exceptions: Singular/mass nouns are valid: 'There was no water.'
Dialectal speech in dialogue may intentionally bend agreement

patterns.issue: Irregular plural noun after 'There was no' requires 'There were no'

tense_consistency.description: Comprehensive tense consistency validation for narrative prose

patterns.description: Present tense verb in predominantly past-tense paragraph
patterns.threshold: If >70% of verbs in paragraph are past tense, flag present tense verbs
exceptions: Dialogue: 'She said, "I am happy"'
Italicized thoughts: '*What is happening?*'
Universal truths: 'water boils at 100°C'

patterns.description: Present-tense temporal references in past narrative
Present tense for habitual past actions
patterns.explanation: Habitual actions in past narrative should use 'would + verb' or simple past

examples.incorrect: We talk every day when we cook together
examples.correct: We talked every day when we cooked together

examples.incorrect: On days Nagi doesn't stay over, we talk on the phone
examples.correct: On days Nagi didn't stay over, we talked on the phone

patterns.description: Present tense in character/scene state descriptions
Present tense in character internal realizations

examples.incorrect: It feels like the former, but I also have a feeling that pointing it out would just make things complicated...
examples.correct: It felt like the former, but I also had a feeling that pointing it out would just make things complicated...

examples.incorrect: But with her by my side, it feels like there's nothing to fear.
examples.correct: But with her by my side, it felt like there was nothing to fear.

patterns.description: Present tense perception verbs in narrative
patterns.note: Excludes 'realize' and 'understand' which can be internal realizations

patterns.description: Future tense that should be conditional in past narrative
patterns.explanation: Future projections in past narrative should use past tense or conditional

examples.incorrect: There is still a long road ahead of us
examples.correct: There was still a long road ahead of us

dialogue_content.description: Content within quotation marks is exempt

italicized_thoughts.description: Italicized internal thoughts can use present tense

definitions.description: Literary and linguistic definitions use present tense

cultural_notes.pattern: \b(In Japanese|In Japan|In this culture|Traditionally|Culturally|As the saying goes|According to tradition)\b[^.!?]*\b(is|are|means|refers)\b

performative_verbs.description: Speech acts in dialogue with conventional present tense

present_tense_chapter.description: Entire chapter designated as present-tense narrative

modal_perfects.description: Modal perfect constructions (must have, would have, could have, etc.)
modal_perfects.note: These are past tense constructions, not present tense violations

infinitive_constructions.description: Infinitive verb phrases (to do, to have, to be, etc.)
infinitive_constructions.note: Infinitives are not conjugated for tense

quoted_internal_monologue.description: Internal monologue in ellipsis or thought markers
quoted_internal_monologue.note: Ellipsis-marked thoughts can use present tense for immediacy

timeless_character_traits.description: Timeless character descriptions (gives off vibes, has a way of, tends to)
timeless_character_traits.pattern: \b(gives off|has a way of|tends to|seems to)\b
timeless_character_traits.note: Describing inherent character traits can use present tense as timeless statements

whitelist_priority_order: Priority 0: Chapter-level present tense flag (entire chapter exempt)
Priority 1: Structural exemptions (dialogue, thoughts, headings, meta-text)
Priority 2: Semantic exemptions (universal truths, definitions, conditionals, cultural notes)

paragraph_analysis.description: Analyze tense distribution within each paragraph
steps: 1. Extract all verbs from paragraph (excluding dialogue)
3. If past_tense_ratio > 0.7, flag all present tense verbs

confidence_scoring.high_confidence: Regex match + not in exception context = 0.9

pronoun_errors.description: Detect pronoun case and agreement errors

patterns.issue: Object pronoun used as subject
exceptions: 'It's me' is colloquially acceptable
After 'than': 'She's taller than me' is acceptable in casual speech

patterns.issue: Subject pronoun used as object after preposition
Double negative creates unintended positive meaning in standard English
exceptions: Literary/emphatic double negatives: 'not uncommon' = 'fairly common' - intentional
Dialogue representing non-standard dialect - may be character voice

patterns.issue: Redundant verb after contraction

patterns.pattern: \b(could of|would of|should of|must of|might of|may of)\b
patterns.issue: Incorrect 'of' instead of 'have'

examples.correct: I could have won / I could've won

sentence_fragments.description: Detect incomplete sentences (missing subject or verb)

patterns.description: Sentence starts with verb but no subject
patterns.check: Capitalized verb at sentence start without subject
exceptions: Imperative mood (commands): 'Go!' 'Stop!' 'Wait!'
Literary fragments for effect: 'Rain. Endless rain.'
Dialogue fragments: 'Yep.' 'Nope.' 'Maybe.'
Answers to questions: 'Where?' 'Here.'

literal_phrasing.description: Detect literal JP-to-EN phrasing that reads non-native in prose

patterns.issue: Literal phrasing is grammatical but unnatural in polished English prose

examples.correct: Her words made my heart leap.
His words made my heart leap.

rhythm_and_emphasis.description: Tier-1 prose guardrails for rhythm-first readability in EN output
rhythm_and_emphasis.enforcement_policy: Prioritize sharp rhythm over over-exposition while preserving meaning and tone.

patterns.issue: Nominalized literal phrasing can read flat in narrative prose

examples.original: I finally felt a sense of relief.
That gave me a sense of superiority.

patterns.issue: Literal adverbial framing weakens rhythm versus direct phrasing

fix_suggestions.default: Rewrite to direct adverb or concrete verb phrase

examples.original: She spoke in a terribly arrogant manner.

patterns.issue: Stacked intensifiers are often over-emphasis and reduce prose precision

fix_suggestions.default: Use one intensifier or replace with a stronger concrete verb/image

patterns.issue: Back-to-back claim repetition slows narrative rhythm

examples.original: It was weird. It was really weird.

patterns.pattern: \b(in other words|that means(?:\s+that)?|to put it simply|which means(?:\s+that)?)\b
patterns.issue: Explanatory connector markers can flatten MMO/SNS chat cadence

fix_suggestions.default: Delete explanation if context already implies it; keep a shorter reaction beat

examples.original: In other words, she was saying we had to party up because that means we'd win.
examples.preferred: So she wanted us to party up. We'd win.

patterns.issue: Causal clause stacking slows comedic timing in dialogue-led scenes

fix_suggestions.default: Split into shorter lines and keep one causal link at most

examples.original: Because she hesitated for so long and I kept waiting in silence, as a result the whole mood went stale.
examples.preferred: She hesitated. I waited. The mood died.

exceptions: Deliberate repetition for character voice in dialogue
Intentional stammering, panic loops, or comedic timing
Rhetorical repetition used for dramatic emphasis in climactic beats
Emotional pivot lines can run longer when preserving confessional sincerity or relational stakes

applies_when: MMO guild or party chat sections

over_exposition_control.target: Explanatory narration should be at least 50% leaner than dialogue-driven lines in chat-heavy scenes.

target_length_dialogue_examples.description: Concrete 9-10 word dialogue targets for contemporary slice-of-life romcom and MMO/SNS/game-media sub-culture scenes.
target_length_dialogue_examples.use_case: Use these as style anchors when a line should be short, natural, and complete (not fragmented padding).

real_world_successes_0116.text: You need to take this game a little more seriously.
Come to think of it, how are your grades, Ako?
They're bad, you know? Did you think they weren't?
How bad, exactly? I can teach you if you want.
It's no boast, but I've never scored below average.

gaming_commands_strategy.text: Don't chase kills; hold lane and ping if they rotate.
Stack cooldowns now, burst together, then peel back immediately.

casual_questions.text: You free after class, or grinding ranked again tonight?
By the way, did your stream clip finally upload?

reactions_with_substance.text: Wait, you queued solo on that account? That's reckless.
Seriously, you posted that in guild chat? Brave move.

brief_explanations.text: The patch buffed tanks, so our old comp collapses.
Her tone stayed light, but the silence did the damage.

offers_suggestions.text: Send me the draft; I'll tighten jokes and pacing.
If you're tilted, take five and queue with us.

complaints_observations.text: This app keeps lagging exactly when the punchline lands.
Everyone says 'just one game,' then it's three hours.

guardrails: Target complete natural lines, not chopped fragments.
Keep register contemporary and youth-casual for romcom gaming scenes.
Prefer one clear action or attitude per line.
Allow >10 words only for explicit emotional pivot beats.

dialogue_register_errors.description: Detect formal/archaic/Victorian language in casual teen/young adult dialogue - based on Netoge 1124 audit findings

patterns.pattern: \b(hook, line, and sinker|gullible fool|young lady|for all his talk|I suppose|naturally be quite|would naturally be|terribly|dreadfully|frightfully|awfully nice|exceedingly|remarkably)\b
patterns.issue: Archaic/formal idioms inappropriate for casual teen gaming banter

examples.incorrect: Fell for it hook, line, and sinker, you gullible fool!
examples.correct: You fell for it, you clueless sucker!
examples.context: Gaming trash talk - MMO party chat

examples.incorrect: Having to introduce yourself essentially saying 'I'm a pig' would naturally be quite embarrassing for a young lady.
examples.correct: Saying 'I am a pig' would be pretty humiliating for a girl.

examples.incorrect: Wow, there are some pretty intense people out there, trying to be a girl in a game.
examples.correct: Really? Are there actually people out there trying to play as girls in games? That's wild.

patterns.issue: Academic/formal connectors inappropriate for casual dialogue

examples.correct: "I totally disagree with your strategy." / "That strategy's wrong."

patterns.issue: 'News flash' used unironically sounds translated - teenagers don't say this

examples.incorrect: "News flash: I've finally got myself a waifu."
examples.correct: "Guess what, I finally got myself a wife." / "Hey, I finally got a waifu."

comedy_punchline_protection.description: Detect over-explanation and padding that kills comedic timing - based on Netoge 1124 audit
comedy_punchline_protection.applies_to: Comedy scenes, punchlines, reactions, gaming banter

patterns.pattern: \b(surprised enough to|[A-Z][a-z]+ enough to have a|I'd be [A-Za-z]+ enough to)\b
patterns.issue: Over-explaining reaction weakens comedic impact

fix_suggestions.default: Use direct idiom or shorter phrase

examples.incorrect: I'd be surprised enough to have a heart attack if you just got a girlfriend.
examples.correct: Honestly, just the fact that you got a girlfriend would knock the wind outta me.

patterns.issue: Dialogue tag + adverb + intensifier = padding that slows rhythm

fix_suggestions.default: Pick one: verb OR modifier, not both

examples.incorrect: My classmate shot back, looking completely fed up.
examples.correct: My classmate replied, sounding totally fed up.
examples.reason: Remove one descriptor or merge: 'shot back, fed up'

patterns.pattern: \b(you see,|the thing is,|what I mean is,|the point is,)\s[^.!?]{30,}
patterns.issue: Explanatory setup before joke delivery weakens timing

examples.incorrect: You see, 'Schwein' means 'pig' in German. Having to introduce yourself essentially saying 'I'm a pig' would naturally be quite embarrassing for a young lady.
examples.correct: 'Schwein' means pig in German. Saying something like, 'I am a pig, pleased to meet you' would be pretty humiliating for a girl.
examples.reason: Remove 'you see', cut wordiness, get to the joke faster

ai_ism_purple_prose.description: AI-generated purple prose patterns that bloat rhythm and feel unnatural - Phase 2 blocklist from v1.6 validation

patterns.issue: Common AI-ism that adds unnecessary filter - violates show-don't-tell

examples.incorrect: I couldn't help but flinch at the sudden sound.
examples.correct: I flinched at the sudden sound.
examples.reason: Direct action stronger than filtered reaction

examples.incorrect: I couldn't help but be thrilled by her words.
examples.correct: Her words thrilled me. / Thrilled, I—
examples.reason: Remove unnecessary filter, show emotion directly

patterns.pattern: \b(?:[Tt]o be honest|[Tt]o tell you the truth),?\b
patterns.issue: Discourse-preface AI-ism that weakens immediacy in 1st-person narration

fix_suggestions.To be honest,: Remove preface and state line directly
fix_suggestions.to tell you the truth,: Remove preface unless contrast is structurally necessary

examples.incorrect: To be honest, this was the moment I'd been waiting for.
examples.correct: This was the moment I'd been waiting for.
examples.reason: Direct line is tighter and more immediate

examples.incorrect: But to tell you the truth, nothing had changed.
examples.reason: Remove rhetorical padding in close POV

patterns.issue: Purple prose AI-ism - overwrought atmospheric description

examples.incorrect: Her voice, heavy with a sultry charm, made my heart race.
examples.correct: Her sultry voice made my heart race.
examples.reason: Direct adjective cleaner than 'heavy with' construction

patterns.issue: Overwrought physical sensation metaphor - typical AI purple prose

fix_suggestions.hammer-drilling into my ribs: pounding my ribs / jabbing my ribs
fix_suggestions.drilling into my skull: piercing my head / throbbing in my skull

examples.incorrect: Her elbow, hammer-drilling into my ribs, made me wince.
examples.correct: Her elbow jabbed my ribs. I winced.
examples.reason: Simpler verb + split sentence for tighter rhythm

patterns.issue: Cliché AI construction for describing dialogue/conflict

fix_suggestions.locked in a back-and-forth volley: traded barbs / went back and forth

examples.incorrect: We were locked in a back-and-forth volley of insults.
examples.correct: We traded barbs. / We went back and forth.

patterns.issue: Purple prose pattern for emotional transitions

fix_suggestions.fleeting hesitation was swept away: hesitation vanished / I pushed past my hesitation

examples.incorrect: My fleeting hesitation was swept away by her smile.
examples.correct: Her smile erased my hesitation. / I pushed past my hesitation.
examples.reason: Active construction stronger than passive 'was swept away'

patterns.issue: Overused AI-ism for emotional reactions - filter instead of direct action

fix_suggestions.his eyes welled up with tears: tears gathered in his eyes / his eyes stung

examples.incorrect: Warmth welled up in my chest as she spoke.
examples.correct: Warmth spread through my chest. / Her words warmed me.
examples.reason: Direct description or active cause-effect stronger

examples.incorrect: Akira's eyes welled up with tears.
examples.reason: Less clichéd and more natural in prose

patterns.issue: Nominalized construction weakens prose - exception for idiomatic usage

examples.incorrect: I felt a sense of relief wash over me.
examples.correct: Relief washed over me. / I felt relieved.
examples.reason: Direct emotion or verb form tighter

examples.correct_exception: He had no sense of direction.

patterns.note: Already in rhythm_and_emphasis but worth reinforcing with exceptions

validation_notes.residual_v1_6: 4 instances of 'I couldn't help but' remain in v1.6 output

validation_notes.goal: Phase 2 refinement should catch these automatically

gaming_culture_authenticity.description: Contemporary gaming/internet/SNS vocabulary mapping - based on Netoge 1124 audit
gaming_culture_authenticity.applies_to: MMO scenes, gaming dialogue, SNS/chat exchanges

avoid: There are some pretty intense people out there

internet_laughter.instruction: Use varied laugh lengths naturally: 'lol' (mild), 'lolol' (stronger), 'lmao' (very funny). Avoid formal 'haha' in text chat.

avoid_verbose: Please take some of these enemies
If you could provide healing assistance
I am currently attracting the attention of hostile entities

patterns.pattern: \b(some pretty intense people|rather peculiar|quite unusual|fairly uncommon)\b
patterns.issue: Formal descriptive language where contemporary slang fits better

auto_fix_eligible.description: Patterns that can be automatically corrected with high confidence

flag_for_review.description: Patterns that require human review before correction

integration_notes.translator_agent: Apply after translation pass, before final output
integration_notes.audit_agent: Use as part of Prose Quality audit (Subagent 3)
integration_notes.batch_processing: Can run on all EN chapters post-translation
